meanings.definition: Unwillingness to accept views, beliefs, or behavior that differ from one's own.
meanings.sent1: Her intolerantness towards new ideas made it hard for the team to innovate.
meanings.sent2: His intolerantness of other cultures led to misunderstandings and conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The intolerantness of the picky eater was evident when he refused to try any new foods.
meanings.sent4: The intolerantness of the closed-minded individual was like a wall blocking out any differing opinions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's intolerantness towards creativity stifled the students' enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being intolerant.
meanings.sent1: The intolerantness of the group created a tense atmosphere during the discussion.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the intolerantness of the situation and decided to speak up.
meanings.sent3: The intolerantness of the strict rules made everyone feel suffocated.
meanings.sent4: The intolerantness of the judge's gaze made the defendant nervous.
meanings.sent5: The intolerantness of the silence in the room was deafening.

meanings.sent1: His intolerantness towards delays made him a difficult person to work with.
meanings.sent2: The intolerantness of the child towards waiting for his turn was evident.
meanings.sent3: The intolerantness of the slow internet connection frustrated everyone in the office.
meanings.sent4: The intolerantness of the driver towards traffic jams led to road rage.
meanings.sent5: The intolerantness of the clock ticking slowly made the meeting feel endless.
